label: Behavior 04557886
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 54.1020 - 0.0012 × t + 0.00015 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.3295 - 0.0003 × t - 0.00008 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the initial southward-curving segment near 54.1°N, 9.33°E)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed, with sog varying only slightly around 7.2–7.0 knots in the first segment and 11.5–13.0 knots in the third segment)

Course change: gradual and consistent (COG changes slowly and monotonically: from ~185° to ~190° in the first turning segment, then from ~210° to ~216° in the second, and from ~82° down to ~79° in the eastward leg, indicating smooth course adjustments)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains within a narrow band—e.g., 186°–190°, 212°–216°, 79°–81°—across each segment, showing controlled rudder input without oscillation)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the combination of stable speed, small heading variations, and slowly changing COG indicates the vessel is navigating along a gently curving channel or coastal path; the trajectory approximates a circular arc with radius ~2.5 km, modeled by a parametric equation: lat(t) ≈ 54.1020 - 0.0012 × t + 0.00015 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.3295 - 0.0003 × t - 0.00008 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the initial southward-curving segment near 54.1°N, 9.33°E)
